subject: JUnit 4 RFE: expected=name
msgSnippet: I m not sure if this is possible/plausible with annotations, but I thought I d ask. Here s how we test for an expected exception in JUnit 4:
messageBody:
I'm not sure if this is possible/plausible with annotations, but I
thought I'd ask. Here's how we test for an expected exception in JUnit 4:

@Test(expected=ArithmeticException.class) public void divideByZero() {
int n = 2 / 0;
}

The .class feels superfluous and unnecessary. Why not just:

@Test(expected=ArithmeticException) public void divideByZero() {
int n = 2 / 0;
}

Could the framework somehow recognize ArithmeticException as the name of
a class and find the necessary Class object?

The big benefit would simply be cleaner code.

Package issues might make this difficult. I.e. I would not want to have
to type

@Test(expected=java.lang.ArithmeticException) public void divideByZero() {
int n = 2 / 0;
}
